content: crochet candy corn pattern skill level beginner measures 3 - 4 inches tall materials stitches and abbreviations notes ● worsted weight yarn in white orange ● r - round ● this pattern is worked in and yellow ● chain - chain continuous rounds do not join ● 3 25mm crochet hook size d or hook ● single_crochet - single_crochet ● the candy corn can be started with of your choice ● st - stitch a magic_ring for a tighter ● two 8mm safety eyes ● sts - stitches beginning hole ● black embroidery thread ● increase - increase ● a stitch marker is recommended ● polyfil stuffing ● whipstitch to help keep track of rounds ● yarn needle ● increases and color changes ● scissors should like up on the sides ● stitch marker optional ● the project should be sort of flat with white r1 chain 2 and single_crochet 6 in second chain from hook 6 ​ r2 *increase single_crochet in next 2 sts* repeat 2x 8 ​ r3 *increase single_crochet in next 3 sts* repeat 2x 10 ​ r4 *increase single_crochet in next 4 sts* repeat 2x 12 ​ r5 *increase single_crochet in next 5 sts* repeat 2x 14 ​ r6 *increase increase single_crochet in next 5 sts* repeat 2x 18 ​ your candy corn should be flat with increases and color changes on the side edges switch to orange r7 - 8 2 rounds single_crochet in each st 18 ​ r9 *increase increase single_crochet in next 7 sts* repeat 2x 22 ​ r10 single_crochet in each st 22 ​ r11 *increase increase single_crochet in next 9 sts* repeat 2x 26 ​ r12 - 13 2 rounds single_crochet in each st 26 ​ add 8mm safety eyes between rounds 10 and 11 with 3 sts between the eyes with embroidery thread add a smile in the round below make sure your white/orange color change is on the side edge you want your orange/yellow change to line up so add 1 or 2 single_crochet to get there if needed switch to yellow r14 *increase increase single_crochet in next 11 sts* repeat 2x 30 ​ r15 - 16 2 rounds single_crochet in each st 30 ​ r17 *increase increase single_crochet in next 13 sts* repeat 2x 34 ​ r18 single_crochet in each st 34 ​ add 2 or 3 scs to get to the edge if needed cut yarn leaving a 12 inch tail and stuff your candy corn whipstitch the bottom of your candy corn closed pull yarn through the body and trim ​ i hope you enjoyed this pattern if you have any questions or concerns please feel free to contact me at any time this pattern is the property of babycakesstudios so please do not claim this pattern as your own you are welcome to sell finished products made from this pattern but do not sell this pattern as your own thank you for more patterns visit babycakesstudios com
